name: Culture.SG
summary:
Introducing Culture.SG

Unified Event Aggregator ‚Äì Pulls event data from NHB, NAC, community pages, and partner organisations. Users can search by date, location, event type, and language, eliminating the need to browse multiple sites.

Personalised Recommendations ‚Äì Uses user preferences and past searches to suggest relevant upcoming events, improving discovery and conversion.

‚ÄúRandom Fun Fact‚Äù Feature ‚Äì Delivers bite-sized cultural trivia or heritage insights from a verified database, subtly improving users‚Äô cultural literacy over time.

name: Kua Si Mi
summary:
The Kua Si Mi (KSM) Portal is a confidential online platform designed to empower individuals to share and reflect on bullying experiences without fear of stigma or exposure. Unlike traditional reporting channels, KSM focuses on story-sharing, awareness, and early intervention (based on data trending to inform for further actions taken at community level or schools) rather than formal complaints. Users can anonymously describe incidents of bullying, harassment, or exclusion they have witnessed or experienced.

The submission is screened through an AI tool which detects harmful submissions with security features such as geographical IP restriction as this is meant for SG use only.

name: Roll With It
summary: Roll With It is a web app that helps parents with prams quickly pivot when their journeys are interrupted by MRT train delays, train breakdowns, lift breakdowns, or maintenance. It provides one-stop real-time updates, with step-free reroutes to nearby accessible routes and destinations, saving valuable time and reducing stress.

name: Gowherestudy
summary: The app aims to help secondary school students in Singapore struggling with post-secondary education decisions make informed decisions through assessing their interests and study preferences to recommend post secondary school options.

name: CoatShare (aka CanBorrow?)
summary:
CoatShare connects occasional winter travellers in Singapore with coats they can borrow, rent or buy second-hand from the community.  The app recommends suitable coats based on destination and travel dates, allows side-by-side comparisons, and lets users set alerts for their desired coats ‚Äì making it easy to stay warm with the cost or clutter of owning rarely-used winter wear.  The app thus provides a platform that nudges behavioural change towards sustainability, making it simple to choose sharing over buying. 
Key Features: 
‚Ä¢        Personalised Recommendations ‚Äì Get coat suggestions tailored to your destination, travel dates and preferences. 
‚Ä¢        Availability Alerts ‚Äì Set alerts when no coats match your needs. 
‚Ä¢        Easy List ‚Äì List your idle coats to share with fellow travellers
‚Ä¢        Community Stories ‚Äì Connect with other travellers and contribute towards the movement for thoughtful travel and reducing textile waste.  
Authentication is needed to share or buy coats via the app.

name: SkillPathSG
summary: structred pathway and tailored courses recommendation in the digital/tech space based on user interest

name: Lumina Sanctuary
summary: Lumina Sanctuary offers the new means to feel connected with the heavens through sincere prayers. One can seek clarity through divination practice and get incentivized to meditate/chant more with the chanting bank feature. There's announcement regarding latest community based event to learn about Nichiren Buddhism. For seekers of The Truth, can refer to Sutra page to learn about the ancient philosophy.

name: Streamlite
summary: Streamlite is a smart streaming planner that turns what you feel like watching into a tailored viewing guide and smart subscription plan, optimising across multiple platforms so that your household get the right shows at the best value.

name: SubTrackLah!
summary: SubTrackLah! helps busy professionals in Singapore take control of their digital spending by tracking all subscriptions in one place. From Netflix to cloud storage, it reminds you of renewals, highlights underused plans, and celebrates your savings ‚Äî so you can declutter your digital life and keep more kopi money in your pocket. ‚òïüí∏

name: See Lah!
summary:
A site which hosts 3 different interactive tools. Users can use the tools immediately to create 'sessions' with their teams and they have the option to create a 'Workspace' to save sessions that they have previously conducted with their teams. 

When a user (admin) start a session, there will be a QR Code/Link which another user (participants) can log into to provide their input. After all participants have provided their input, the admin can show the combined input and facilitate a discussion based on how everyone has contributed. There are 3 different tools, i.e. 3 different types of sessions which a user can choose to start depending on the needs of his/her team.

name: SGSafeHome
summary: SGSafeHome is a web-based platform that helps Singapore residents check their home safety readiness, from security measures to emergency preparedness. It provides clear, step-by-step actions to take during emergencies while waiting for help. Primary account holders can invite family members as lightweight guest profiles, who access the account via a secure invitation link without creating full accounts. This enables users and their community to share progress on the preparation checklist and emergency contacts, fostering better coordination and helping everyone be better prepared to handle emergency situations effectively.

name: LifeSwap
summary:
The LifeSwap Concept

LifeSwap is a platform that enables users to exchange 1‚Äì3 hour ‚Äúlife blocks‚Äù providing authentic micro-experiences designed for reflection, learning, and human connection. By facilitating these peer-to-peer swaps, LifeSwap cultivates serendipity, empathy, and mental renewal through lived experience.
In doing so, it pioneers a new ‚Äúexperience economy‚Äù that monetizes authenticity and shared humanity, not just curated moments.

name: Race Radar SG
summary:
An app where races are reviewed on 4 metrices on whether it is conducive to chase a fast time.

They are:
1) Race Organisation
2) Distance Accuracy
3) Aid Station
4) Course Conditions

Where for (4), it is further broken down to:
a) Flatness
b) Bottlenecks
c) Road Closure

This app is community-driven, by runners for runners in bid to (1) help competitive runners go to well organised races to run fast and (2) for organisers to see this platform as feedback and over time improve race organising and hence increase overall racing performance in Singapore

name: Weekend Playbook
summary: Weekend Playbook creates customised schedules for parents of children aged 2-12 that incorporate age-appropriate screen time, sleep and physical activity hours, helping parents build confidence in managing their child's digital habits and reduce weekend screen time.

name: MRT Which Door
summary: Find the best door for faster transfers and exits on Singapore MRT

name: My Travel Journal
summary:
My Travel Journal (Your digital companion to capture, organise, and relive every journey.)

My Travel Journal unifies key aspects of travel (destinations, photos, reflections, and spending) into one intelligent platform. It transforms scattered travel data into cohesive visual stories, allowing travellers to document, analyse, and share their experiences effortlessly. With built-in analytics and AI insights, users gain a clearer view of their travel patterns, mindful spending habits, and meaningful memories - all in one place.

name: Convoy Kaki
summary:
Convoy Kaki centralizes convoy coordination through automated matching and unified 
trip itinerary (eliminating WhatsApp chaos); provides real-time Open Charge Map API 
charging visibility with "who's charging where" coordination (preventing checkpoint 
station crowding); surfaces destination recommendations during convoy formation 
(enabling pre-trip planning vs post-arrival browsing); includes interactive VEP/
border checklists 48h before departure; and integrates SeaLion AI assistant for 
customs/immigration support, Malaysian food culture guidance (halal options, 
regional specialties, dining etiquette), and culturally-aware local insights‚Äî
reducing trip anxiety, coordination delays, and cultural missteps while building 
confidence for repeat cross-border exploration.

name: Don't Waste Food Lah
summary: The app will be a match-making app between event organisers and users associated with an organisation. The app is intended to function with minimal inputs from users, event organisers and organisations to encourage adoption. Users can register as a food recipient and associate themselves with up to 3 organisations. Other users who organise events can use the same app to create events and broadcast alerts when there is excess food available for consumption.

name: AI@Work Navigator
summary:
Personalised recommendations: web app uses a quiz to personalise recommendations for users in the functional domains, and the curated information can directly help them in improving their productivity at work.

Comprehensive information in one-stop: The website compiled information from the web which include courses, tools, and workflows, that can help professionals across HR, Legal, Marketing, and Accounting embrace AI and GenAI technologies to improve efficiency. there are also information on ethical considerations of AI in their day-to-day workflows.

Every business will have these functional roles. This webapp will be useful even for the smallest SME.

name: BotaniCare
summary:
BotaniCare helps users keep track of their plants with simple tools for logging watering and fertilising, along with clear care histories.

A built-in Telegram bot can send daily care reminders and weather-based alerts, which are especially useful for outdoor setups.

Users can organise plants into Groups and mark each group as Indoor or Outdoor, with weather notifications sent only to outdoor groups.

BotaniCare also includes a plant diary, where users can record notes and photos to document growth, troubleshoot issues, or track changes over time. Diary entries can be shared directly with the community, creating a space where users learn from each other through real examples, updates, and discussions.

A straightforward tool for users managing anything from a small indoor collection to a larger outdoor garden.

name: That Time We
summary: That Time We is an AI-assisted journaling web app that makes it easy to compile, caption, and relive shared memories. It transforms scattered photos, videos, and thoughts into organised, story-rich journals that can be revisited at any time. Users can create folders, add captions, locations, and tags, and co-curate albums without the clutter or privacy concerns of social media. With AI-powered features and a visual, low-effort design, it helps users of all ages ‚Äî from seniors to families ‚Äî to cultivate the habit of journaling and collate treasured memories in a single digital space.

name: My DigitLife Compass
summary:
The MyDigitaLife Compass web app aims to streamline workflow by providing a single, seamless platform for Digital Ambassadors to engage seniors more effectively during community outreach events. 
It reduces manual steps, improves consistency of engagement, and enhances seniors‚Äô overall experience. It also empowers DAs with real-time information, shortens engagement cycles, and aims to raise the current 10% conversion rate to at least 30%.

name: RetireReady
summary: The webapp provides a Retirement Readiness Score to help working adults aged between 25 to 60 to achieve their desired retirement lifestyle according to their preferred retirement age. The application gathers key financial and lifestyle indicators - such as savings, investments, insurance converage, debts and retirement goals and converts them into a Readiness Score. Users can explore personalised recommedations, adjust lifestyle or financial inputs, and visualise how these changes impact their retirement outlook, enabling them to make informed decisions on their lifestyle.

name: MyMakanMap
summary: A personal restaurant wishlist that lets diners save discovered restaurants, view them on a list and map, and filter by location, price, or cuisine for quick selection.

name: CaseSync
summary:
A web application that consolidates fragmented student support workflows into a single collaborative system for Case Management Teams. Features dual architecture supporting both student-centric profiles for ongoing cases and incident-centric logging for discrete events, with real-time cross-role collaboration, privacy-protected referrals, AI-powered intervention recommendations, and mobile-responsive access. Transforms case management from a fragmented 5-8 hour weekly process into a coordinated workflow under 3 hours, ensuring vulnerable students receive timely support without repeatedly sharing traumatic experiences across different staff members.

Core Value: Reduces administrative burden while enabling coordinated student support through unified data access and seamless collaboration.

name: CardLobang
summary: CardLobang eliminates decision paralysis for young Singaporeans by instantly calculating their Estimated Annual Financial Benefit and recommending the single most rewarding entry-level credit card for their unique spending habits, driving confident applications.

name: CleanCompare.sg
summary:
Compare. Choose. Clean.
Singapore‚Äôs easiest way to find trusted cleaning pros.

name: VoucHere
summary: VoucHere helps users find places to use their SG60 vouchers by showing users places near them where they can use their vouchers. The filters tailored to popular preferences (Halal, vegetarian, cafes) help the user further narrow their search.

name: Next Chapter
summary: Next Chapter is a web application that connects retired PMETs with volunteer opportunities that match their interests, skills and availability, helping them rediscover purpose while making a meaningful impact in the community after leaving the workforce. The application allows users to sign up for volunteering opportunities, invite friends to join in the volunteering events and share their experiences to inspire others. Community agencies can also participate through a dedicated portal where they post opportunities and manage volunteer sign-ups.

name: BuildWhat.sg
summary: Marketplace to connect product builders and user testers.

Harmonix: Interactive Vocal Training App 

Harmonix is a web-based singing training application that helps users develop their pitch accuracy and harmony skills through interactive exercises. The app uses your device's microphone to listen to your singing in real-time and provides instant feedback on your performance.

How it works:
1.        Onboarding: When you first use the app, you select your voice type (male or female) so the exercises are calibrated to a comfortable pitch range for you. The app then tests your microphone to ensure it can hear you properly.

2.        Progressive Learning Path: The app has three levels that gradually increase in difficulty:
‚Ä¢        Level 0: Pitch matching basics - You sing simple sustained notes to develop pitch accuracy
‚Ä¢        Level 1: Melody singing - You learn to sing familiar melodies note-by-note
‚Ä¢        Level 2: Harmony training - You sing harmony notes (like major and minor thirds) while the app plays a reference melody

3.        Real-time Feedback: As you sing, the app analyzes your voice using pitch detection technology and shows:
‚Ä¢        Visual feedback on whether you're hitting the right notes
‚Ä¢        Your pitch compared to the target pitch (with visual bars and graphs)
‚Ä¢        Helpful hints and encouragement from an animated mascot character
‚Ä¢        Progress tracking showing your accuracy scores

4.        Adaptive Difficulty: You need to achieve certain scores to unlock higher levels. The app tracks your best performances and lets you retry exercises to improve.

name: Fit5
summary:
A  wellness platform designed for busy Singaporeans, integrating five key pillars: Move (Âä®), Eat (ÂêÉ), Nourish (ÂÖª), Calm (Èùô) and Rest (‰ºë). Fit5 delivers bite‚Äësized, practical wellness tasks that fit seamlessly into daily routines‚Äîwhether you‚Äôre commuting, working, or winding down. Fit5 helps you build healthy habits without overwhelming your schedule.

By focusing on small, consistent actions rather than lengthy routines, Fit5 makes wellness accessible, sustainable and efficient‚Äîso you can prioritise your physical health (without needing to be an expert) and feel better each day.

name: Find My Kaki!
summary: A digital platform specificially designed around MDDI officer's preferences, adressing current gaps in cross-division connection and workplace friendships. With 'Find My Kaki', officers can have a low-pressure and interest-based channel to make new friends beyond their own divisions.

name: GiftSG
summary: GiftSG is a one-stop social gifting platform that helps corporate staff easily discover and purchase meaningful gifts from multiple social enterprises in Singapore. Users can browse curated items from crafts to corporate sets, view each product‚Äôs social impact, and check out with consolidated payment and delivery. By simplifying procurement and giving equal visibility to both large and small non-profits, the platform enables companies to fulfil CSR goals while supporting diverse beneficiary communities.

name: Orbit
summary: Orbit is a social fitness web app that helps busy working adults stay consistent through community and accountability. Users can create and share workouts, find partners with similar schedules, and join sessions happening soon to overcome decision fatigue. The app also features likes, comments, and streak celebrations to keep motivation high, and a 6-month visual progress tracker to monitor consistency over time.

name: Sgcarhub
summary:
SGcarhub is a one-stop car forums that targets to cover all car models sold in Singapore which will allow car owners/users to 
(i) obtain useful car related info which will help all local car owners/users in their car ownership journey such as good deals like car tires, legal performance parts, good external workshops that have experts in dealing with their car models' maintenance issues, etc.; and 
(ii) form an integrated local car community where it gathers all local car owners/users together and organise car related community events like short food trips in Malaysia, cross country travel to Thailand, tracking event in Sepang circuit, etc. to foster community bonding. 

Car owners/users will no longer need to spend time searching across overlapping, unverified or even false online sources for information on their cars and feel that they are always on their own in the car ownership journey.

name: Feedback Genie
summary: This is an AI-powered App Store review analyzer that fetches iOS app reviews and automatically generates comprehensive insights including sentiment analysis, pain points, feature requests, trends, and improvement opportunities.

name: Odyssey
summary:
Odyssey streamlines IMDA‚Äôs content workflows by centralising briefs, edits, approvals and version tracking into one clear process for the Communications and Marketing team and all Business Lines. It replaces lengthy email back-and-forth among all parties with clear stages, defined roles, and automated reminders that speed up collaboration and reduce rework. Online annotation on webpage and social post previews makes feedback simpler, and the built-in AI assistant suggests draft captions and web articles in IMDA‚Äôs tone and social personas, giving every team member a consistent base to build from.


Feature summary (no login):
https://techup5-odyssey.com/feature-summary

Bedtime story (no login):
https://techup5-odyssey.com/user-manual

name: From Dusk to Dawn
summary: From Dusk to Dawn is a web app supporting young mothers through pregnancy loss with grief journey tracking and access to curated community support groups, professional help and resources to facilitate healing at their own pace.

name: Taste of Home
summary: Taste of Home helps families preserve and share their culinary heritage. The app makes it easy for seniors to record their recipes using voice, photos, and text inputs, ensuring that no family favourite is ever lost. From traditional family staples to modern household favourites, each recipe captures the warmth and story behind every dish. Family members can browse, try, and celebrate these recipes together, creating a living cookbook that grows with each generation. With Taste of Home, passing down recipes becomes more than just sharing food. It‚Äôs preserving memories, culture, and love through cooking. Taste of Home is available in all 4 official languages and is mobile responsive to improve accessibility to Singaporean seniors.

name: setgo!
summary: SetGo! is a family-oriented web application designed to help children aged 9-12 develop time management skills and earn rewards for completing daily activities. The app combines scheduling, gamification, and parental oversight into an engaging platform that teaches responsibility.

name: Collaterals Must Share
summary: Collaterals Must Share (CoMuSh) is a platform that facilitates the sharing of collaterals between teams while ensuring accurate stocktaking. It helps officers preparing for events easily identify existing collaterals suitable for use, seek the necessary approval to use the collaterals, and return any unused collaterals after events. It is currently tailored to the Translation Department but could potentially serve more teams.

name: SgSchoolfinder by PT
summary:
sgschoolfinder-pt is a webtool that allows parents of P5/P6 students to shortlist secondary schools based on public transport accessibility from their homes. Parents and their children can further refine this shortlist by 2 additional important criteria - PSLE cut-off points and CCA availability. 

This shortlisting tool can be useful when 1) parents of P6 students have to submit 6 ranked schools during the Sec 1 posting exercise following the release of PSLE results, 2) parents and their P5/P6 students are shortlisting schools to visit for respective open houses. 

This tool complements MOE's schoolfinder website which parents can use to find out more information about their shortlisted schools.

name: CareConnect SG
summary: CareConnect SG eliminates the research burden for family caregivers by consolidating Singapore's fragmented eldercare resources into one intelligent platform. Instead of spending 15-20 hours researching across multiple government agencies, caregivers receive instant, personalised matches to relevant grants, services, and support programmes based on their specific situation. The platform transforms complex navigation and information-gathering into a simple, streamlined experience that connects families directly to the government support they need.

name: InTouch Again
summary:
InTouch Again is a relationship rekindling platform that helps mid-life adults in Singapore overcome the awkwardness of reconnecting with old friends, former colleagues, and past acquaintances.

It provides guided reflection prompts to recall meaningful memories, pre-written message templates to reduce the intimidation of reaching out, calendar integration for concrete meetup scheduling, and progress tracking with milestones to transform social intentions into consistent action. Ultimately addressing the emotional inertia that causes years of social drift and increased loneliness

name: One-stop cross-border taxis from anywhere in Singapore to Johor (Larkin).
summary: A one stop platform for passengers to get Singapore licenced cross-border taxis from any part of Singapore to Johor (Larkin).

name: PantryPal
summary:
PantryPal helps users keep track of the food in their kitchens to reduce preventable food waste (i.e. uncooked or unconsumed food). Users record the items they have, along with expiry dates.

The app features an email notification system that sends alerts to users to remind them of items that are about to expire, ensuring nothing gets forgotten and wasted. It also tracks discarded items and analyses this data to show users their most common source of food waste and estimated money wasted, to help shape their behaviour. Users can also access food storage guidance to learn how to reduce food spoilage.

Together, these features help users reduce preventable food waste through better kitchen management.

name: ChaTea
summary: ChaTea bridges the Chinese tea discovery gap by matching tea-curious beginners with teas they'll love through personalized taste-matching and brewing guidance, while helping seasoned drinkers validate quality through community-validated, tea-specific reviews.  It solves for both the "where do I start?" and "is this tea actually good?" problems in one accessible platform.

name: Legal/Tech Compass
summary: Legal/Tech Compass is a web-based platform designed to help lawyers, in-house teams, and legal operations professionals discover, evaluate, and effectively use digital and AI tools that can enhance their legal workflows.
